page.title: 10Glassenbury Forge in present
page.content: This old forge is still being used as a Blacksmiths & Farriers by Clive Stearn and Philip Dunwall with a boy apprentice. They have worked here for the last fifteen years. Most of the horses are visited on the farms monthly to have the shoes fitted but shoes are made in the forge using the time- honoured method with the furness. This forge was the last to shoe oxen. The only way to keep the oxen quiet was to 'throw' them on to their backs while attending to their shoes. Fire baskets and handles are the other craft work undertaken by the blacksmiths. The area they cover for their work includes Smarden, Hawkhurst, Wadhurst & Headcorn. The firm is a family one originating from Yalding. They spend one and a half days a week working in the forge.
